comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: The "new" Gaol was opened in1892. There's a delightful description of a reporter's visit and the names of guards etc. Could these be the folk posing outside the new building (with the door open)? From the 'Barrier Miner' (Broken Hill) 17/1/1892 p.4 - trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/44088907 Google Street View - maps.google.com/maps?f=q&source=s_q&hl=en&geo...

comment.author: 32162360@N00
27331537@N06
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] Thanks for your research, we will update the caption to "c.1892". ...I see there was an escape from the newly-opened gaol just a week before this reporter's story but he wasn't on the run for long. Our catalogue, Archives Investigator [see Advanced Search --> Agency --> 463], states that "the prisoners were transferred to the new premises on 8 November, 1892 which is considered to be the commencement date of the new Broken Hill Gaol." The prisoners were transferred from Silverton Gaol (the Police Gaol at Broken Hill) opened in 1888 and disestablished after the transfer of prisoners in 1892. AB
